page.title: 09Landscape of Vernham Dean CP
page.content: The landscape is some of the most varied and beautiful in Hampshire. The southern part of the area is gently sloping land rising from the south to a height of 750 feet and giving extensive views over Andover and beyond. The land is then traversed by a valley with a steep southern face. The valley contains the village of Upton at a height of 400 feet. The northern side of the valley returns to a height of about 750 feet to give extensive views northwards over Vernham Dean into Berkshire. The area retains a reasonable amount of woodland which is generally deciduous, although there is one plantation of conifers. The varied landscape and the woodland provide ideal habitat for wildlife including deer, badger, fox and pheasant.
